message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of pollution on the atmosphere. When pollution levels get higher, certain gases in the atmosphere, such as carbon dioxide, trap more heat and contribute to a phenomenon known as global warming. This leads to an increase in temperatures. Option (B) is incorrect because pollution does not directly cause the atmosphere to dry up. Option (C) is also incorrect because pollution does not directly cause the atmosphere to melt away. Option (D) is incorrect because pollution contributes to the warming of the earth, not cooling.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of pollution on the atmosphere and climate. When pollution levels get higher, the gas in the atmosphere, such as carbon dioxide and methane, can trap heat and contribute to the greenhouse effect. This leads to a rise in temperatures on Earth. Option (B) is incorrect because pollution does not cause the gas in the atmosphere to dry up. Option (C) is incorrect because pollution does not cause the gas in the atmosphere to melt away. Option (D) is incorrect because pollution contributes to global warming and therefore causes an increase in temperatures, rather than cooling the Earth.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of pollution on the atmosphere. When pollution levels increase, the gas in the atmosphere, specifically greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide, trap heat and lead to higher temperatures. This is known as the greenhouse effect. Option (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because they do not describe the effects of pollution on the atmosphere.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of pollution on the atmosphere. When pollution levels get higher, the gas in the atmosphere, such as carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases, trap more heat from the sun. This leads to an increase in temperatures on Earth, contributing to global warming. Option (B) is incorrect because pollution does not cause the gas in the atmosphere to dry up. Option (C) is incorrect because pollution does not cause the gas in the atmosphere to melt away. Option (D) is incorrect because pollution does not cool the Earth, but rather contributes to warming.

Option (B) is incorrect because pollution does not directly cause the gas in the atmosphere to dry up. Option (C) is incorrect because the gas in the atmosphere does not melt away. Option (D) is incorrect because pollution leads to higher temperatures, not cooling of the Earth.

Option (D) is incorrect because pollution does not cool the Earth, but rather warms it.

Option (B) is incorrect because pollution does not cause the gas in the atmosphere to dry up. Option (C) is incorrect because pollution does not cause the gas in the atmosphere to melt away.
